verses.kjv: Josiah was eight years old when he began to reign, and he reigned thirty and one years in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name was Jedidah, the daughter of Adaiah of Boscath.
verses.web: Josiah was eight years old when he began to reign, and he reigned thirty-one years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Jedidah the daughter of Adaiah of Bozkath.
verses.ct: Josiah was 8 years old when he became king, and he reigned 31 years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Jedidah, the daughter of Adaiah from Boscath.

verses.kjv: And he did that which was right in the sight of the LORD, and walked in all the way of David his father, and turned not aside to the right hand or to the left.
verses.web: He did that which was right in LORD’s eyes, and walked in all the way of David his father, and didn’t turn away to the right hand or to the left.
verses.ct: He did what was right in the eyes of the LORD and followed the example of his ancestor David in every way, never turning aside to the right or to the left.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the eighteenth year of king Josiah, that the king sent Shaphan the son of Azaliah, the son of Meshullam, the scribe, to the house of the LORD, saying,
verses.web: In the eighteenth year of king Josiah, the king sent Shaphan, the son of Azaliah the son of Meshullam, the scribe, to LORD’s house, saying,
verses.ct: In the 18th year of King Josiah's reign, the king sent Shaphan son of Azaliah, the son of Meshullam, who was the court scribe, to the house of the LORD with these instructions:

verses.kjv: Go up to Hilkiah the high priest, that he may sum the silver which is brought into the house of the LORD, which the keepers of the door have gathered of the people:
verses.web: “Go up to Hilkiah the high priest, that he may count the money which is brought into LORD’s house, which the keepers of the threshold have gathered of the people.
verses.ct: "Go to Hilkiah the high priest and have him count the money that has been brought into the house of the LORD, which the doorkeepers have collected from the people.

verses.kjv: And let them deliver it into the hand of the doers of the work, that have the oversight of the house of the LORD: and let them give it to the doers of the work which is in the house of the LORD, to repair the breaches of the house,
verses.web: Let them deliver it into the hand of the workmen who have the oversight of LORD’s house; and let them give it to the workmen who are in LORD’s house, to repair the damage to the house,
verses.ct: Have them turn it over to the supervisors in charge of the work on the house of the LORD, and let them pay the workers who are repairing the damage to the house —

verses.kjv: Unto carpenters, and builders, and masons, and to buy timber and hewn stone to repair the house.
verses.web: to the carpenters, and to the builders, and to the masons, and for buying timber and cut stone to repair the house.
verses.ct: the carpenters, builders, and masons — and use it to purchase timber and cut stone to restore the house.

verses.kjv: Howbeit there was no reckoning made with them of the money that was delivered into their hand, because they dealt faithfully.
verses.web: However there was no accounting made with them of the money that was delivered into their hand; for they dealt faithfully.”
verses.ct: But don't require an accounting from them for the money placed in their hands, because they are dealing honestly."

verses.kjv: And Hilkiah the high priest said unto Shaphan the scribe, I have found the book of the law in the house of the LORD. And Hilkiah gave the book to Shaphan, and he read it.
verses.web: Hilkiah the high priest said to Shaphan the scribe, “I have found the book of the law in LORD’s house.” Hilkiah delivered the book to Shaphan, and he read it.
verses.ct: Then Hilkiah the high priest told Shaphan the scribe, "I have found the book of the law in the house of the LORD." Hilkiah handed the book to Shaphan, and he read it.

verses.kjv: And Shaphan the scribe came to the king, and brought the king word again, and said, Thy servants have gathered the money that was found in the house, and have delivered it into the hand of them that do the work, that have the oversight of the house of the LORD.
verses.web: Shaphan the scribe came to the king, and brought the king word again, and said, “Your servants have emptied out the money that was found in the house, and have delivered it into the hands of the workmen who have the oversight of LORD’s house.”
verses.ct: Shaphan the scribe went to the king and gave his report: "Your servants have collected the money found in the house and have turned it over to the workers supervising the repairs on the house of the LORD."

verses.kjv: And Shaphan the scribe shewed the king, saying, Hilkiah the priest hath delivered me a book. And Shaphan read it before the king.
verses.web: Shaphan the scribe told the king, saying, “Hilkiah the priest has delivered a book to me.” Then Shaphan read it before the king.
verses.ct: Then Shaphan the scribe informed the king, "Hilkiah the priest has given me a book." And Shaphan read it aloud before the king.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when the king had heard the words of the book of the law, that he rent his clothes.
verses.web: When the king had heard the words of the book of the law, he tore his clothes.
verses.ct: When the king heard the words of the book of the law, he tore his clothes.

verses.kjv: And the king commanded Hilkiah the priest, and Ahikam the son of Shaphan, and Achbor the son of Michaiah, and Shaphan the scribe, and Asahiah a servant of the king’s, saying,
verses.web: The king commanded Hilkiah the priest, Ahikam the son of Shaphan, Achbor the son of Micaiah, Shaphan the scribe, and Asaiah the king’s servant, saying,
verses.ct: The king gave orders to Hilkiah the priest, Ahikam son of Shaphan, Achbor son of Michaiah, Shaphan the scribe, and Asahiah the king's servant:

verses.kjv: Go ye, enquire of the LORD for me, and for the people, and for all Judah, concerning the words of this book that is found: for great is the wrath of the LORD that is kindled against us, because our fathers have not hearkened unto the words of this book, to do according unto all that which is written concerning us.
verses.web: “Go inquire of LORD for me, and for the people, and for all Judah, concerning the words of this book that is found; for great is LORD’s wrath that is kindled against us, because our fathers have not listened to the words of this book, to do according to all that which is written concerning us.”
verses.ct: "Go and inquire of the LORD for me, for the people, and for all of Judah about the words of this book that has been found. The LORD's wrath burns fiercely against us because our ancestors did not obey the words of this book or follow everything written in it concerning us."

verses.kjv: So Hilkiah the priest, and Ahikam, and Achbor, and Shaphan, and Asahiah, went unto Huldah the prophetess, the wife of Shallum the son of Tikvah, the son of Harhas, keeper of the wardrobe; (now she dwelt in Jerusalem in the college;) and they communed with her.
verses.web: So Hilkiah the priest, Ahikam, Achbor, Shaphan, and Asaiah, went to Huldah the prophetess, the wife of Shallum the son of Tikvah, the son of Harhas, keeper of the wardrobe (now she lived in Jerusalem in the second quarter); and they talked with her.
verses.ct: So Hilkiah the priest, along with Ahikam, Achbor, Shaphan, and Asahiah, went to Huldah the prophetess. She was the wife of Shallum son of Tikvah, the son of Harhas, who was keeper of the wardrobe. She lived in Jerusalem in the Second Quarter. They spoke with her,

verses.kjv: And she said unto them, Thus saith the LORD God of Israel, Tell the man that sent you to me,
verses.web: She said to them, “LORD the God of Israel says, ‘Tell the man who sent you to me,
verses.ct: and she told them, "This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: Tell the man who sent you to me,

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, Behold, I will bring evil upon this place, and upon the inhabitants thereof, even all the words of the book which the king of Judah hath read:
verses.web: “LORD says, ‘Behold, I will bring evil on this place, and on its inhabitants, even all the words of the book which the king of Judah has read.
verses.ct: 'This is what the LORD says: I am about to bring disaster on this place and its people — everything written in the book that the king of Judah has read.

verses.kjv: Because they have forsaken me, and have burned incense unto other gods, that they might provoke me to anger with all the works of their hands; therefore my wrath shall be kindled against this place, and shall not be quenched.
verses.web: Because they have forsaken me, and have burned incense to other gods, that they might provoke me to anger with all the work of their hands, therefore my wrath shall be kindled against this place, and it will not be quenched.’ ”
verses.ct: Because they have abandoned me and burned incense to other gods, provoking my anger with everything their hands have made, my wrath will be poured out on this place and will not be quenched.'

verses.kjv: But to the king of Judah which sent you to enquire of the LORD, thus shall ye say to him, Thus saith the LORD God of Israel, As touching the words which thou hast heard;
verses.web: But to the king of Judah, who sent you to inquire of LORD, tell him, “LORD the God of Israel says, ‘Concerning the words which you have heard,
verses.ct: But as for the king of Judah, who sent you to inquire of the LORD, tell him this: 'This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says about the words you have heard:

verses.kjv: Because thine heart was tender, and thou hast humbled thyself before the LORD, when thou heardest what I spake against this place, and against the inhabitants thereof, that they should become a desolation and a curse, and hast rent thy clothes, and wept before me; I also have heard thee, saith the LORD.
verses.web: because your heart was tender, and you humbled yourself before LORD, when you heard what I spoke against this place, and against its inhabitants, that they should become a desolation and a curse, and have torn your clothes, and wept before me; I also have heard you,’ says LORD.
verses.ct: Because your heart was tender and you humbled yourself before the LORD when you heard what I declared against this place and its people — that they would become an object of horror and a curse — and because you tore your clothes and wept before me, I have heard you,' declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: Behold therefore, I will gather thee unto thy fathers, and thou shalt be gathered into thy grave in peace; and thine eyes shall not see all the evil which I will bring upon this place. And they brought the king word again.
verses.web: ‘Therefore behold, I will gather you to your fathers, and you will be gathered to your grave in peace. Your eyes will not see all the evil which I will bring on this place.’ ” ’ ” So they brought this message back to the king.
verses.ct: 'Therefore I will gather you to your ancestors, and you will be laid in your grave in peace. Your eyes will not see all the disaster I am going to bring on this place.'" They brought this message back to the king.
